t: Psalm 69
For the director of music. To the tune of “Lilies.” Of David.
Save*pn me, O God, for*ld the waters have come up to my neck.
I*ln sink in the miry depths, where*ld there is no foothold. I*ln have come into the deep waters; the*ld floods engulf me.
I*ln am worn out calling for help; my*ld throat is parched. My*ln eyes fail, looking*ld for my God.
Those*ln who hate me without reason outnumber*ld the hairs of my head; many*ln are my enemies without cause, those*ld who seek to destroy me. I*ln am forced to restore what*ld I did not steal.
You,*pn God, know my folly; my*ld guilt is not hidden from you.
Lord,*pn the Lord*s Almighty, may*ld those who hope in you not*ld be disgraced because of me; God*ln of Israel, may*ld those who seek you not*ld be put to shame because of me.
For*ln I endure scorn for your sake, and*ld shame covers my face.
I*ln am a foreigner to my own family, a*ld stranger to my own mother’s children;
for*ln zeal for your house consumes me, and*ld the insults of those who insult you fall on me.
When*ln I weep and fast, I*ld must endure scorn;
when*ln I put on sackcloth, people*ld make sport of me.
Those*ln who sit at the gate mock me, and*ld I am the song of the drunkards.
But*pn I pray to you, Lord,*s in*ld the time of your favor; in*ln your great love, O God, answer*ld me with your sure salvation.
Rescue*ln me from the mire, do*ld not let me sink; deliver*ln me from those who hate me, from*ld the deep waters.
Do*ln not let the floodwaters engulf me or*ld the depths swallow me up or*ld the pit close its mouth over me.
Answer*pn me, Lord,*s out of the goodness of your love; in*ld your great mercy turn to me.
Do*ln not hide your face from your servant; answer*ld me quickly, for I am in trouble.
Come*ln near and rescue me; deliver*ld me because of my foes.
You*pn know how I am scorned, disgraced and shamed; all*ld my enemies are before you.
Scorn*ln has broken my heart and*ld has left me helpless; I*ln looked for sympathy, but there was none, for*ld comforters, but I found none.
They*ln put gall in my food and*ld gave me vinegar for my thirst.
May*pn the table set before them become a snare; may*ld it become retribution and a trap.
May*ln their eyes be darkened so they cannot see, and*ld their backs be bent forever.
Pour*ln out your wrath on them; let*ld your fierce anger overtake them.
May*ln their place be deserted; let*ld there be no one to dwell in their tents.
For*ln they persecute those you wound and*ld talk about the pain of those you hurt.
Charge*ln them with crime upon crime; do*ld not let them share in your salvation.
May*ln they be blotted out of the book of life and*ld not be listed with the righteous.
But*pn as for me, afflicted and in pain— may*ld your salvation, God, protect me.
I*pn will praise God’s name in song and*ld glorify him with thanksgiving.
This*ln will please the Lord*s more than an ox, more*ld than a bull with its horns and hooves.
The*ln poor will see and be glad— you*ld who seek God, may your hearts live!
The*ln Lord*s hears the needy and*ld does not despise his captive people.
Let*pn heaven and earth praise him, the*ld seas and all that move in them,
for*ln God will save Zion and*ld rebuild the cities of Judah. Then*ln people will settle there and possess it;
the*ld children of his servants will inherit it, and*ld those who love his name will dwell there.
